Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can correctly draw one land habitat, such as a playground or forest, with detailed features appropriate to the habitat.
The student can accurately draw one water habitat, such as a pond or lake, with elements like water lilies or algae.
The student can illustrate a rich diversity of plants in each habitat, such as trees, bushes, and flowering plants, including specific types that thrive in each environment.
The student can depict a variety of animals specific to each habitat, like squirrels and ants in a land habitat and fish and frogs in a water habitat.
The student can effectively show the differences between the types of living things found in the two habitats, highlighting habitat-specific diversity.
The student can identify and represent patterns of plant and animal diversity in their habitats, noting specific adaptations or ecological roles.
CANNOT: The student may have minor issues with the scale or proportions of certain features (e.g., making trees disproportionately large compared to animals).
The student might occasionally mislabel a specific species, although the overall diversity and relationship is accurately represented.
